step1.sentence: After two years away from competitive tennis, she trained relentlessly and managed to make a comeback, reaching the finals of a major tournament.

step2.story: Everyone said his career was over after the scandal, but he refused to give up. He spent a year rebuilding his reputation and skills, determined to make a comeback. When he finally returned to the stage, the audience gave him a standing ovation.

step3.story: The band had broken up a decade ago, leaving fans with only memories of their sold-out concerts. Then, one quiet Tuesday morning, a cryptic post appeared on their social media: a single flame emoji. Speculation exploded online as people wondered if they were about to make a comeback. Weeks later, they announced a reunion tour with new material, and tickets sold out in minutes. Standing backstage before their first show, the lead singer felt a mix of nerves and excitement she hadn't felt in years. The crowd's roar as they walked on stage told her everything — some legacies are simply too strong to stay buried.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 다시 돌아온다는 뜻으로, 한때 성공했다가 사라졌던 사람이나 것이 다시 나타나는 것을 의미합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 주로 스포츠, 연예, 비즈니스 등에서 한동안 부진하거나 은퇴했다가 다시 활동을 재개하며 성공을 거두는 상황에 사용합니다. '재기에 성공하다'는 뉘앙스를 담습니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'comeback'은 19세기 말 미국 영어에서 '반박', '응수'의 의미로 쓰이다가, 20세기 초 스포츠와 연예계에서 '복귀·재기'의 의미로 자리잡았습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 복귀가 아니라 어려움을 극복하고 다시 두각을 나타낸다는 긍정적이고 감동적인 뉘앙스가 강합니다. 대개 역경이나 실패가 선행되어야 이 표현이 자연스럽게 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The veteran boxer made a stunning comeback after a three-year absence from the ring.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그 베테랑 복서는 3년간 링을 떠났다가 놀라운 재기를 이루어냈다.
